snippet: In its latest conflict with Israel, Hamas is supported by regional powerhouses and is demonstrating its strength compared with a weak and crisis-laden Palestinian Authority.
abstract: Hamas's forceful response to Israel's killing of its top military commander, Ahmed al-Jabari,  highlights new emboldened nature of group, which is now supported by Qatar, Turkey and Egypt;  Hamas has been sending rockets into Israel, in what is seen as both show of strength and diplomatic attempt to expand alliances with countries in Arab world and beyond.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and FARES AKRAM
byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: In its latest conflict with Israel, Hamas is supported by regional powerhouses and is demonstrating its strength compared with a weak and crisis-laden Palestinian Authority.

headline.seo: Hamas, Emboldened, Tests Its Arab Alliances
headline.main: Bolder Hamas Tests Alliances in a Shifting Arab World
headline.print_headline: Hamas, Emboldened, Tests Its Arab Alliances

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
